title: 105_s88
content: The Act titled "Improved Patient Access to Clinical Studies Act of 1997" provides coverage for individuals participating in approved clinical studies under the Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974. The Act "Improved Patient Access to Clinical Studies Act of 1997" ensures that group health plans and health insurance issuers cannot deny coverage for items and services provided to enrollees participating in approved clinical studies. This includes treatment according to the study design or for conditions resulting from participation. Discrimination based on study participation is prohibited. The Act "Improved Patient Access to Clinical Studies Act of 1997" prohibits group health plans and health insurance issuers from denying coverage for items and services in approved clinical studies. Payment for such items and services is not required by the plan or issuer. An approved clinical study is defined as a research study approved by specified entities or a peer-reviewed research program. The Act "Improved Patient Access to Clinical Studies Act of 1997" prohibits denial of coverage for items and services in approved clinical studies. An approved clinical study is a research study approved by specified entities or a peer-reviewed research program. Amendments to the Public Health Service Act include defining criteria for determining the safety and efficacy of treatments. "SEC. 2706. COVERAGE FOR INDIVIDUALS PARTICIPATING IN APPROVED CLINICAL STUDIES." Group health plans and health insurance issuers cannot deny coverage for items and services provided to an enrollee participating in an approved clinical study. The coverage must be in line with the study's design or to treat conditions resulting from participation. Discrimination based on participation in the study is prohibited. Group health plans and health insurance issuers are not required to pay for items and services typically covered in an approved clinical study. An approved clinical study is defined as a research study approved by various health authorities or a peer-reviewed research program. The curr_chunk discusses the definition of an approved clinical study as determined by the Secretary of Health and Human Services. It specifies that the study must be conducted to determine the safety, efficacy, or other necessary characteristics of a treatment. The curr_chunk discusses the application of section 2706 to health insurance coverage in the individual market. The amendment made by this Act is effective for group health plans starting on or after January 1, 1998, and for individual market health insurance coverage on or after the same date.
